com.datamelt.rules.core.action

Class ConvertAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.datamelt.rules.core.action.GenericAction
      • com.datamelt.rules.core.action.ConvertAction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class ConvertAction
extends GenericAction
    Class containing actions that are related to the conversion of values. Actions belong to a rulegroup and are execute depending on the status of rulegroup - if it passed or failed (or both).
    Author:
    uwe geercken
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • toInteger

        @ActionAnnotation(description="Convert a String to an int value",
                  methodDisplayname="convert to integer")
 @ActionMethodAnnotation(note="returns zero if the given string cannot be converted")
public int toInteger(XmlAction action,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       java.lang.String value)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                throws java.lang.Exception
        converts a given string to an integer value
        Parameters:
        action - the action to use
        value - the value to convert
        Returns:
        int
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - when the string can not be converted

      • fourDigitTimetoMinutes

        @ActionAnnotation(description="Convert a four character String which represents time (format: hhmm) to an integer value representing minutes",
                  methodDisplayname="convert 4 characters time")
 @ActionMethodAnnotation(note="returns zero if the given time cannot be converted")
public int fourDigitTimetoMinutes(XmlAction action,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      java.lang.String value)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               throws java.lang.Exception
        converts a given string of four characters which represent hour and minutes in the format "hhmm" to an integer value. example 0133 = 1 hour, 33 minutes = 93 minutes
        Parameters:
        action - the action to use
        value - the value to convert
        Returns:
        integer
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - when the string can not be converted

      • fiveDigitTimetoMinutes

        @ActionAnnotation(description="Convert a five character String which represents time (format: hh:mm) to an integer value representing minutes",
                  methodDisplayname="convert 5 characters time")
 @ActionMethodAnnotation(note="returns zero if the given time cannot be converted")
public int fiveDigitTimetoMinutes(XmlAction action,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       java.lang.String value)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                throws java.lang.Exception
        converts a given string of five characters which represent hour and minutes in the format "hh:mm" to an integer value. The third character is the delimiter between hours and minutes. example 30:26 = 30 hours, 26 minutes = 1826 minutes
        Parameters:
        action - the action to use
        value - the value to convert
        Returns:
        integer
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - when the string can not be converted
